params.taskDescription:
In a pairwise comparison election, the four candidates initially received the following points for winning matchups: A 2, B <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>1</mn>

    <mn>1</mn>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">1\frac{1}{2}</annotation></semantics></math>,
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>1</mn>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">1\frac{1}{2}</annotation></semantics></math>, C 1, D  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>1</mn>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">1\frac{1}{2}</annotation></semantics></math>. When candidate C dropped out of the election, the remaining candidates received: A 1, B  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>1</mn>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">1\frac{1}{2}</annotation></semantics></math>, D <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>

    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{1}{2}</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription: In a pairwise comparison election, Candidate C was a Condorcet candidate in a straw poll. When the actual election took place, several voters up-ranked Candidate C on their ballots, but no other changes were made to the voter preferences, and Candidate B won the election.

questionSetStimulus: For the following exercises, identify which fairness criteria, if any, are violated by characteristics of the described voter profile. Explain your reasoning.
